title: How to Make Cordials

steps.headline: Decide on what flavor you want the cordial.
steps.description: Berries are popular, pears and plums work well, so does pineapple; almost any fruit will work.

steps.headline: Coarsely chop the fruit if needed; two cups of fruit per one quart mason jar works well.
Add one cup of sugar; white granulated sugar is standard.
Fill the rest of the way with vodka, brandy, or a mixture of the two.
Cap the jar, and shake vigorously, to dissolve the sugar.
Shake the jar daily, until the sugar stays dissolved.
Keep the jar in a cool place, preferably out of direct sunlight.
Wait for six months, while the fruit flavor infuses the alcohol.
Re-bottle the now-finished cordial in an attractive jar, if desired.

text: Decide on what flavor you want the cordial. Berries are popular, pears and plums work well, so does pineapple; almost any fruit will work. Coarsely chop the fruit if needed; two cups of fruit per one quart mason jar works well.  Add one cup of sugar; white granulated sugar is standard. Brown sugar is also good. Fill the rest of the way with vodka, brandy, or a mixture of the two.  Cap the jar, and shake vigorously, to dissolve the sugar.  Shake the jar daily, until the sugar stays dissolved.  Keep the jar in a cool place, preferably out of direct sunlight.  Wait for six months, while the fruit flavor infuses the alcohol.  Strain the cordial.  Re-bottle the now-finished cordial in an attractive jar, if desired. Label, and enjoy.
